attributes.action: Make horse riders pick up their horses excrement! Or slap them with a fine!
attributes.background: Why should horse riders get away with leaving massive piles of dump in the middle of the road and down our streets, when dog owners get slapped with a massive fine for a little dump! All pets should be treated with the same rules! No excuses!

attributes.action: Tax breaks for Arts subject tuition, for school age children.
attributes.background: Arts education for young people continues to be subject to yearly cuts. Arts tuition outside of school education is costly, but now necessary to provide sufficient learning opportunities for talented children. This is inaccessible to many families. Help end the elitism and value the arts.
attributes.additional_details:
UK government prioritises "core" subjects (Maths, English, Sciences, Language, History Geography) by way of the EBacc performance measure: http://bit.ly/1QiubcJ  Whereas these subjects should be valued, it's at the expense of arts subjects. 

What is being asked here is a small contribution to arts education, that would actually help boost the economy at the same time. The Warwick Commission estimates the arts sector represents 5% of the British economy valued at £76.9bn: http://bit.ly/1EJWbkV

attributes.action: Fine drunks to stop the abuse of the NHS and knock-on risk to lives!
attributes.background: Introduce legislation automatically fining drunks requiring NHS ambulance/medics, to stop their NHS abuse, by turning it into the National Hang-over Service.  Ambulances and medics attending drunks are services unavailable for genuine and so more worthy emergencies, with consequential risk to life.
attributes.additional_details: Police can impose a £100 fine for “Being drunk & disorderly”. Someone so drunk requiring NHS services is defacto “drunk & disorderly” and so should be automatically fined at least £100.  Ideally introduce a new charge of “Being drunk & disorderly to the extent of requiring NHS services” with a minimum fine of £500, increased annually by £500 until the problem has been eliminated – with all monies going direct to the NHS. 31 Dec. fines should be double to fund Emergency staff double time.

attributes.action: The UK Government to ask the Nigerian Govt to end sexual abuse of victims of BH
attributes.background:
https://www.naij.com/1065882-how-nigerian-officials-sexually-abuse-and-steal-from-boko-haram-victims.html
Please help me and Bayo Olupohunda @BayoOlupohunda highlight the plight of these forgotten women and children.
attributes.additional_details: There are around 5,000 women and children in Internal Displacement Camps in Nigeria, they have been raped by Boko Haram terrorists and have either escaped or been released and have ended up in the IDP camps, the stigma of having been taken by BH means that many of them can't return to their homes. Corrupt officials in the camps are diverting food and medical supplies and are raping the women and girls too. Haven't these women and girls suffered enough?

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a hound used in a drag hunt to participate without a muzzle
attributes.background: Mistakes occur in drag hunts to often, wild mammals, mainly hares and foxes are still being mutilated, injured or killed by hunting hounds, this generaly occurs when the pack go off the trail and catch the real scent of a wild animal instead of the artifical scent which is used when drag hunting
attributes.additional_details:
In 2004 the Hunting Act was passed which bans the hunting of wild animals with dogs in England and Wales, the act does not affect drag hunting (when hounds are trained to follow an artifical scent). 
Passing a law which requires hounds being used for drag hunting to be muzzled or persons involved to be prosecuted will lead to clearer intentification of illegal hunts making prosecution easier. www.facebook.com/KeepTheFoxHuntBan/
This site shows various video and photo documenations.

attributes.action: Move Houses of Parliament to the North of England
attributes.background: Government is considering a multi billion pound refurbishment of the Houses of Parliament. It would seem that now would be an ideal opportunity to relocate from this outdated building and move to a more central location within the UK, near Manchester for example.
attributes.additional_details: With Brexit, the development of HS2, the northern powerhouse and other regional investments, a massive project like re-locating the seat of our democracy to the regions would create huge opportunities. Business and industry often follow politics and one would hope that the same could be said if the Houses of Parliament were to re-locate to any of the regions.

attributes.action: To limit fireworks to organised, licenced events before 9 at night.
attributes.background: I feel that nervous animals, the elderly and young children suffer when fireworks are set off at all hours on any day. 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10 and 1  o clock in the morning last night for example.
attributes.additional_details: One of my dogs who had had dental surgery began to bleed again due to her being stressed..repeatedly. People who have to get up early,  young children and the elderly cannot sleep. I'm a nurse who has witnessed elderly dementia patients think they're back in world war 2 because the loud bangs remind them of bombs going off. At least if fireworks were limited to set days and times we could prepare for it better. You can't give animals calming medication continually just in case.

attributes.action: free bus pass from the age of 60 for people living in England
attributes.background: People living in Scotland,Wales,N Ireland,and even London,can get a free bus pass.I feel that it discriminates against people living in England.

attributes.action: ban the use of prong and shock collars for dogs within the UK.
attributes.background: Prong and shock collars can cause psychological and physical harm to dogs even when correctly used and can even precipitate aggression in the animal. At present there is no legislation restricting their use and anyone can apply them to any dog.
attributes.additional_details: Many so called trainers many with few or no qualifications use them and get obedience because the dog is terrified of the pain and distress caused rather than because it has been well trained. Alternative methods are effective  see site https://positively.com/dog-training/methods-equipment/training-equipment/choke-and-prong-collars/ for details of the injuries caused by these devices

attributes.action: Make cyclists pay road tax and insurance, and have a licence plate.
attributes.background:
The other day I was stopped at traffic lights.
A cyclist overtook me and went straight through the red light and turned left narrowly missing a car coming from the other direction.
Fortunately there was not an accident but there could have been.

This isn't the first time I've seen this happen.
attributes.additional_details: A registration number would help convicting cyclists for traffic offences.

attributes.action: Bring back compulsory dog licences. Making it offence to own a dog without one.
attributes.background:
Unfortunately back in 1987 when policing  issues were harder this law was Abolished. 
With modern laws and regulations a new licence can be enforced. 
This will aid in the reduction of Back Yard Breeding and the ever increasing over population of stray dogs in rescue centres accross the country.
attributes.additional_details:
Most countries still have licences. 
Having one makes the owner accountable for its dogs actions. 
If your dog goes missing the chances of getting it back are greater. 
No puppy can be bought without a licence including their vaccination details. 
Greater fines for owners without a licence.
DNA records would be held for prosecution and identification purposes. 
Breeders can only sell dogs with a recognised licence and permit.
Service dogs would be free. 
Elderly concession rates.

attributes.action: Make basic paediatric first aid/cpr part of antenatal care
attributes.background: Many babies/young children could be saved if new parents were given guidance on simple cpr and first aid in relation to babies and young children. Early Years Professionals and healthcare professionals receive training, however, parents (who are with their children the majority of the time) do not.

attributes.action: Take Military Action against ISIL both here in the UK and abroad.
attributes.background: In light of the recent terrorist attacks in France and Germany, I would call upon the UK Government to take Military Action against ISIL both here in Britain and Abroad.

attributes.action: Stop organisations from charging more for not making payment by Direct Debit.
attributes.background: Direct debit gives a third party open access to your wallet and bank account at any time and at will. Those who pay by other LEGAL methods are penalized with higher fees. In effect its a stealth tax charged by companies who want easy access to YOUR money. Its not right, Its not moral and its unjust.
attributes.additional_details:
If funds are not available or a payments going into account are not there on time due to bank errors or delays in employee payments or benefit payments it can cause LIFE THREATENING problems for those on a low budget as bank fees are taken from allowances put aside for food or essentials. This puts incredible pressure those on a tight budget who are hit the most with unrealistic fees for returned direct debits forcing them into further debt.

This is immoral for modern day British Companies.

attributes.action: Make political education a compulsory lesson in schools
attributes.background: I am an 18 year old who has been shocked with the political results in 2016. Many have complained that recent referendum and election results are due to uneducated voters. Politics affects everyone, so why is it that not everyone understands or it taught about it?
attributes.additional_details: Not once in my education have I ever had a politics lesson. Even though I didn't choose to study this subject at a level, I am interested in it and feel it is vital that every student has a basic understanding of it. By scheduling compulsory political lessons for everyone you are telling young people that it matters and that their vote matters. Lack of education leads people to make uninformed choices that can have a huge effect on the end result. Let's end uneducated votes.

attributes.action: End industrial breeding of domestic pets to protect the welfare of  animals.
attributes.background:
The Australian Government has just introduced new legislation into Parliament. Their Domestic Animals Act protects the welfare of breeding animals to ensure that their pets come from good homes.
By overhauling the Animal Welfare Act 2006, we in the UK can reform breeding and pet shop industries.
attributes.additional_details:
• Reduce the number of fertile female dogs a breeder can keep.

• Crack down on backyard breeders, so they will have to register with their council as a Domestic Animal Business.

• Establish a Registry of these businesses, giving councils the information to determine who is eligible to register as a breeder and better police the new laws.

• Pet shops will no longer be able to sell puppies and kittens unless they have come from a registered breeder, foster home, animal shelter or charity.

• Foster Carers who look after pets waiting for new homes will have clearer rights and responsibilities – caring for animals without having to register as a Domestic Animal Business, but with the benefit from reduced council registration fees.

attributes.action: Gelatine in our food must be marked what animal it is from and in bold writing.
attributes.background: Gelatine is in our food, sweets, pharmaceutical products and many other products. If a product contains Gelatine, it must be written what animal it is from and it must be in bold writing. Food products that contain Gelatine must be clearly marked in bold writing Not suitable for vegetarians.

attributes.action: The government to help victims of domestic violence
attributes.background: social services need further training with dealing with women of domestic violence they are quick enough to take children away from women but they are not trained to support women in getting out of these relationship or helping women to be reunited with their children
attributes.additional_details: All cases involving social services and courts should have a expert witness available to explain to everyone the effects and complications of domestically violent relationships also to help everyone understand it. Too many women are just deemed as bad mothers for not being able to escape domestically abusive relationship when there is no support even from social services

attributes.action: Make all technical sporting goods in the UK tax free to encourage participation
attributes.background: Cycling has increased in popularity immensely since the success of the 2012 Olympics and due to the Government's cycle to work scheme allowing tax free purchasing of cycle equipment. I would like to see all technical sporting goods to be tax free to encourage more people to take up sport in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The Olympic success in 2012 and 2016 has shown that the UK has the ability to be a great sporting nation. We should encourage more sporting participation and a healthier lifestyle by allowing tax free purchases on all technical sporting goods and not just for those in full time employment. Clothing would be exempt but hardware would be tax free. E.G bicycles, helmets, running trainers, weight training equipment, trekking poles, climbing equipment etc anything which encourages sporting activity.

attributes.action: Make an allowance for children with social challenges to have term time holiday
attributes.background: Children on the autistic spectrum for instance can find being around others difficult, it can be overwhelming and make them very uncomfortable. They often need more space and time to adjust and process and they ought to have the opportunity for a relaxing holiday, like any one else.
attributes.additional_details: Term time holidays would allow for a quieter environment, more physical and mental space, slower / calmer interactions with people, less stress caused by social situations, less queuing, less waiting, a break from peers, the result being a calmer and more relaxed child and therefore family.

attributes.action: Replace all Benefits with a Universal Guaranteed Minimum Income
attributes.background: Guaranteed minimum income means the provision of identical payments from a government to all of its citizens, that is unconditionally granted to all on an individual basis, without means test or work requirement.
attributes.additional_details:
A basic income will provide a more substantial safety net for all people. and will contribute to less working hours, better working conditions and a better distribution of jobs. 

It is a means for sharing out the wealth produced by a society to all people. 

It can help people do other work and reconsider old choices.

It rewards unpaid contributions to society that our economy increasingly relies on. 

And is a way to redistribute the advantages of on-going technological advancement.

attributes.action: Subsidise Care Fees for the elderly by using money from  Overseas Aid.
attributes.background: Why should the elderly have to sell their homes to fund their care when billions are spent, much of it wasted, on foreign aid.  Surely we should look after our own first, before borrowing money to spend on foreigners.

attributes.action: A Law to give temp shelter to all rough sleepers if temps are predicted at Zero.
attributes.background:
Put a Law in place, that forces local authorities to give shelter to all rough sleepers should temperatures be predicted at below zero. 
Just today, this guy died on our streets, make it stop
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/tragedy-unknown-homeless-man-found-9372526?ICID=FB_mirror_main
attributes.additional_details:
Every year these guys face all weather conditions, and it is not acceptable by any means, there should be a law placed that these guys know that should the weather drop to zero they will be allocated some shelter, should they want it. 
Each local authority should be forced to allocate shelter by the Government, and I ask that a law be put in place to protect those in this difficult situation.

attributes.action: SUSPEND THE £118,000,000.00 GIVEN BY UK TO BURMA THIS YEAR INDEFINITELY
attributes.background:
Britain must save money,especially before uncertain times like BREXIT, when ID CHECKS at hospitals are proposed,the question is,why's BURMA set to receive £118 million from the British taxpayer
when clearly committing crimes against humanity,
and addressing it is the responsibility of all humanity
attributes.additional_details:
PM meeting with Burmese State Counsellor Aung San Suu Kyi: 13/09/16 -Downing Street spokesperson said: "The Prime Minister said we stood ready to provide further assistance as Burma continues to develop, including through £118 million in support this year."

Yale study suggested that the abuse of the more than one million Rohingya may amount to genocide;a confidential United Nations report to the Security Council says it may constitute “crimes against humanity under international criminal law.”

attributes.action: Repeal ALL anti-smoking legislation.
attributes.background: Smoking tobacco is a legal past time, the Government has no legitimate right to restrict a legal activity.  The covering up of cigarettes in shops is ridiculous and counter productive.  Plain packaging does not work.  The high taxation is counter productive and encourages smuggling.

attributes.action: Urge the Norwegian Government to end the culling of wild wolves
attributes.background: Norway has announced that it plans to allow hunters to kill 47 wolves living in the wild, despite the species being listed as "critically endangered" on the 2015 Norwegian list of endangered animals. This represents the cull of up to two-thirds of the country's total wild wolf population.
attributes.additional_details:
- Rovdata recorded a wolf population of between 65-68 in winter 2015-2016.
- Nina Jensen, the head of the Norwegian branch of the WWF has called the plans "outright mass slaughter".
- Illustrative datapoint: a 2010 study by the U.S. Department of Agriculture showed that out of 1.7 million cattle deaths that year, only 2.3 percent were caused by predators (of which many are attributed to dogs and other predator species).
- The UK considers itself as a leader in animal welfare standards.

attributes.action: BRING BACK THE NIT NURSE
attributes.background: We all know that the little critters are at large within schools. But they have got significantly worse over recent years. Bringing back the nit nurse would give those parents who don't regularly check their children's hair the extra push they need.
attributes.additional_details: It is unfair on all children involved. I myself have had to treat my daughter 3 times in the 2 weeks she's been back at school. This is almost abuse. Let's help all people involved.

attributes.action: Recommission Britannia and give the Queen her boat back - she's earned it!
attributes.background: The Queen has been selfless in her work for this country and the Commonwealth. We took one her great loves away from her and its about time Great Britain and the Commonwealth gave her something back.
attributes.additional_details: This would also benefit Great Britain in its pursuit of international trade deals following its exit from the EU.

attributes.action: PLEASE GIVE RIGHT OF APPEAL TO TIER 1 ENTREPRENEUR INITIAL & EXTENSION VISA
attributes.background: Our request to all Honourable UK Parliament members is that please restore the right of appeal for Tier 1 entrepreneur applicants if refused due to errors, Appeal right defend the applicants and allow them to provide solid evidence against the raised issues
attributes.additional_details: Applicants can apply for an administrative review of the Tier 1 entrepreneur refusal decision if they think that Home Office has made an error in considering their application.When they apply for administrative review, no evidence is allowed to forward in favour of the refused application. This means that if Home Office maintained the refused decision then they order applicants to leave the country ASAP and they could lose their running business and investment that could ruin their future

attributes.action: Rethink healthcare provision on the Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
We reject the STP for Hampshire and the Isle of Wight. We demand that:
Comprehensive, high quality, place based systems of care be maintained at least at their present level on the Isle of Wight
GP and dentistry services are safeguarded
Resources for community mental health services are increased
attributes.additional_details: The current Government has created record NHS deficits – £2.45 billion and rising. 3.9 million people are on waiting lists for treatment. Last year, 1.8 million people had to wait 4 or more hours in A&E – a fourfold increase since 2010. A quarter of patients have been forced to wait a week or more just to see or speak to their GP or a nurse – some cannot even get an appointment. And now the Sustainability & Transformation Plan (STP) could mean Islanders losing 30% of NHS services.

attributes.action: Put a stop to Annualised/Banked Hours contracts in workplaces.
attributes.background: The government needs to abolish the Banked/Annualised Hours contracts in workplaces. Employees are working over the working time directive, where the additional overtime is banked. This should be paid at a normal or premium rate as standard.
attributes.additional_details: Employees who work under this scheme have to constantly monitor hours that are either "Banked" or "Owed". Sometimes working unsociable hours, or days where the employer will then tactically either stand down employee from shift to ensure further hours are not "Banked", or put unreasonable requests to employees to make up hours "owed".

attributes.action: Back into society and work schemes for survivors of sexual and domestic abuse
attributes.background: lots of centres do not receive enough funding for survivors of sexual/domestic abuse, leaving the victim vulnerable and alone. Often secluded and struggling to live. There are schemes in place to help offenders of such crimes to get back into society and working but no such scheme for victims.
attributes.additional_details: In the last few years the U.K has seen massive cuts to helplines and therapy centres that provide great help to victims of abuse. A scheme was introduced that helps offenders of such abuse get back into society and start working again after their sentence or provides skills and training in prisons. Unfortunately no such scheme is in place to help victims get back into socialising, learning new skills, being able to work and sometimes even keep their homes. This needs to change.

attributes.action: Abolish the High Income Child Benefit Tax Charge
attributes.background:
Abolish the Government's high income child benefit tax charge for an individual income exceeding £50,000 introduced in January 2013. 

This tax charge effects families when a individual parent income exceeds the threshold.  This tax charge means they are no longer eligible for full child benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many instances where an individual parent income is the only source of income for an entire family.  

This tax charge isn't proportionate or fair when compared to a joint couple who's combined income can potentially reach £100,000 and not be subject to any child benefit tax charge. 

This tax charge needs to be abolished it's horrendously unfair and discriminates against many families.  A tax system should be fair across the board, this certainly isn't.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/comment/9788481/Abolish-child-benefit-and-give-families-a-tax-break.html

attributes.action: Create an independent ombudsman for complaints against parcel companies.
attributes.background: Users of companies such as Hermes regularly suffer lost parcels, parcels left out in the open, thrown over walls, in bins, squashed through letterboxes etc. These companies provide totally inadequate compensation, often refusing to accept responsibility, investigate or compensate.
attributes.additional_details:
Some examples of common practise by these companies:
https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/2206718/hermes-delivery-driver-pictured-with-so-many-parcels-crammed-into-his-car-that-it-was-impossible-to-see-out-of-the-passenger-window/

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/weird-news/9-times-delivery-drivers-drove-customers-to-despair-a6745546.html

A litany of complaints by frustrated users with no avenue to turn to:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/490161297788303/

attributes.action: £369 million proposed for Buckingham Palace to be used to fund Social Housing
attributes.background:
The Queen has been given a 66% payrise that will facilitate a £369 million refurbishment. 
Funnily enough the countless homeless on the Queen's own doorstep will not have enough points or be able to bid for any of the vacant rooms. Give this money to build social housing for the homeless.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for schools to teach basic BSL.
attributes.background: Communication  in children is very important. But what happens when the only way to communicate is by sign? Not being able to communicate and make friends can lower a child's self-esteem.Make it mandatory for schools to teach basic BSL in schools.

attributes.action: Rethink the way dla assess babies born and affected by talipes (clubfoot)
attributes.background: My son was born in 2011 with talipes( clubfoot in 1 of his feet) it was turned inwards. From 3 days old he had a full leg cast on, every week we went a 102 mile round trip to see his consultant, At 3 months his tendon cut and then he wore ponsetti boots and bar -firstly for 23hrs a day then 12hrs.
attributes.additional_details: He couldnt kick his legs freely, he couldnt roll over in his bed to get comfortable. He was stuck on his back thumping a metal bar with his little blue boots attached. Some people get dla as the assessor see it requires 'more care' than a normal baby, but like myself we didnt.My son did require more care, and as he got older with the boots on it got harder on him and myself. Dla needs to address this and make a serious decision to if all should get it or none.They are born with this abnormality

attributes.action: more funding for paediatric cardiac teaching more complex /rare heart conditions
attributes.background: My daughter aged 6months died in hospital due to post op complications. She had ebsteins anomaly a rare heart condition.  Doctors in the UK don't know much about this condition and struggle to help fix/ and or treat accordingly.

attributes.action:
Provide CCTV in all Care homes (
Special Needs, Disabled, Dementia, Elderly)
attributes.background: I am a single mum with a son who has autism and should he live in a care home, when i am no longer around, I want him to be protected and all his care to be recorded in case of negligence or abuse.

attributes.action: Make the sale of non-approved spring traps illegal.
attributes.background:
At present it is only illegal to USE non-approved traps. 
The law should be extended to ban the SALE of any trap not approved under the Spring Traps Approval Order 2012.
attributes.additional_details:
The present loop-hole allows sellers to sell inferior imported traps that have not been type-approved by DEFRA. This causes unnecessary suffering as these inferior traps often maim rather than give an instant kill. 

These imports are undemining the businesses in the UK that manufacture the genuine approved products.

attributes.action: Implement a 12 month ban for using mobiles while driving.
attributes.background: Far too many people are still ignoring the fact that people are being injured and killed daily due to mobile phone distraction behind the wheel. If you get caught driving and using your phone you should face the same punishment as drink drivers and be banned from driving for 12 months.
attributes.additional_details:
More than 500,000 drivers still using mobile phones at wheel, study shows
At least one in 20 drivers aged under 30 have been caught flouting the law 
Report said using hand-held device is more dangerous than drink or drugs
In 2013, mobile phone use behind the wheel was factor in 22 fatal collisions


Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/

attributes.action: Abolish the "standard living allowance" under 35!
attributes.background: I am 21 years of age. I was made homeless two weeks ago, I have done everything I possibly could while working part time to get my own place. The government will only pay for me to live in shared accommodation of £210 a month.
attributes.additional_details: I spent long enough explaining to them I am unable to live in shared accommodation due to my mental health issues. I have tried to get a one bed flat and nothing I do for universal credit is good enough. How can the government expect our future generation to live with their parents till 35 because most of us can't get help to live alone! Why are we expected to live like students? Why do they not care for people with mental or physical health disabilities? I now have two options. Live on my friends couch, or move back with my parents which I cannot do. Is this acceptable to keep our younger generation in such horrible circumstances?

attributes.action: Ban the taking of photographs of children in school without the child's consent
attributes.background: The concept of private life is a broad one which encompasses the right to identity.  A pupil's image reveals his or her unique characteristics and constitutes one of the chief attributes of his or her personality.
attributes.additional_details: A child, over the age of 12, must be able to give or withdraw consent to the taking of his or her images in addition to the wishes and feelings of the parents/legal guardians.  At present, there are guidelines published by the Information Commissioners Office as to the taking of photographs at schools.  We argue that this is not sufficient because the use of personal mobile phones within a class room setting by a tutor is not prohibited.

attributes.action: Introduce a maximum term limit for the role of UK Prime Minister
attributes.background: Many countries limit the time that one individual can hold the highest political office. This prevents one individual from dominating the political agenda for too long and amassing too much power. Thus it helps to guard against authoritarianism and the domination of particular interest groups.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of countries in the world have term limits for their Heads of State. This is a widely accepted international norm.

Often these limits apply to presidents rather than prime ministers. However, since the UK is a monarchy, and the Prime Minister is more powerful than the monarch in policy making, it is appropriate to impose such a limit on UK prime ministers.

At a time when the personal power of political leaders is so important, this law is critical to preserving political freedoms.

attributes.action: Call on the government to encourage Concorde to return to the skies.
attributes.background: Concorde was an amazing supersonic passenger aircraft which was in service between London, Paris, New York and Washington DC. Unfortunately it stopped its services in 2003, making an end to supersonic travel. It's ridiculous that today it takes 8 hours to go to New York when before it was only 3.

attributes.action: Urgently bring forward the planned works to the A417 missing link / Birdlip Hill
attributes.background: The A417 birdlip hill (Gloucester) is a notorious accident black spot and is gridlocked on a daily basis, which has a huge impact on commuters, businesses and visitors to the area. The planned works to improve the road much be brought forward as soon as possible to rectify this horrendous situation
attributes.additional_details: http://a417missinglink.co.uk

attributes.action: Build HS2 up to an expanded Doncaster Sheffield Airport (DSA)
attributes.background: DSA is soon to be linked to the M18 a new dual carriageway, the A1 being one junction along the M18 and the M1 only three junctions away.  There is a "lot" of room available for an extra runway, new train station/terminal/parking. DSA has one of the longest runways in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently a train journey from London Kings Cross to London Heathrow takes 51 mins. The fastest train from Kings Cross to Doncaster is 95 mins using existing lines and railway stock, this could be vastly reduced if HS2 were to be built in this direction noting that DSA is also 6 miles South of Doncaster station, giving an extra reduction in transfer time.

Expansion can then be progressed in the North via HS3 and the proposed road route across the Pennines to Manchester.

attributes.action: Tighter regulation on the resale of events tickets.
attributes.background: I tried to buy 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child'. It became clear that many of these tickets were going up onto other sites for hundreds and in some cases thousands of pounds more. Many of these tickets are failing to sell resulting in empty seats in the theatre on performance night.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose that more rigorous legislation is introduced to prevent these websites from being allowed to sell tickets for more than 10% of the face value. 

We cannot allow these websites to dictate the prices to see our favourite shows/bands/sports teams.

Why should these touts be the only people that benefit?

attributes.action: Allow life Imprisonment for cat killers
attributes.background:
People are not scared to kill cats or other animals, as is shown with the Croydon cat killer, he has slaughtered hundreds of cats. However, the maximum sentence for killing a cat is 6 months imprisonment. 
This will not deter awful criminals from ending a poor cat's life.
attributes.additional_details:
More details
http://www.express.co.uk/news/nature/664265/Croydon-cat-killer-jailed-weeks-campaigners-call-for-tougher-sentencing-animal-cruelty 
Animal abusers are locked up for just weeks before coming out and killing again.

attributes.action: Make Politics a mandatory subject for the primary curriculum.
attributes.background: Elections in the US and the recent Brexit vote demonstrate key decisions that the people need to have a good background in Politics to vote on. Giving an education promotes this exploration of politics earlier than just 6 months before a referendum/election. Students can make up their own mind.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.populus.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Remain-and-leave-1.png

http://www.populus.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Remain-and-leave-2.png

People need the chance to have an educated vote, not voting on personality or party without understanding.
